data.text: Bikase VS Arundel: Any Experience with these Adjustable Bottle Cages?

Arundel VS Bikase adjustable cages Does anyone have experience with both of these? I have a couple of Bikase (left pic), they work ok but my only gripe is that the plastic ratcheting system tends to strip (teeth break) especially if exposed to mud and such, and the wheel gets off center as a result. I don't have any experience with the Arundel. There's also an older version of the Bikase (right pic) but I don't think you can get those anymore. Any input is appreciated
It's Fidlock or nothing for me.
data.author: Jeff Emrich

data.text: What is the issue you experience? I have titanium king cages that are expensive but they've never popped a bottle even in the most gruesome situations.

data.text: i had a set of titanium ones, and i literally rattled them loose, like the cage stretched and lost a bottle. Doesn't help that i like to run a fully loaded gravel bike down trails more suited for a dual crown downhill bike sometimes. I'm looking to get one on the underside of the downtube for my tool capsule and, two fork mounted for bottles (where in my opinion they are more susceptible to falling out). The bikase is ok but I'm just afraid that the plastic gears will break off and you end up with an untightenable cage
